about the metropolitan areas with the most accidents was based on faulty data provided by the centers for disease control and prevention, a cdc official said friday. the article and list," america's accident capitals, <q> have been removed from the web site. carl lavin, forbes.com managing editor, said that the initial alarm about the data was sounded by an alert reader. </q> we regret publishing inaccurate information, and we are investigating where else in and out of government the inaccurate data was used, "lavin said." i am grateful to the reader who contacted us. interviewed hundreds of recent macquarie recruits on what attracted them to the merchant bank and how it could position itself in a highly competitive, brand-driven industry." it's really about bringing creative thinking to business problems, <q> bartley says. r laungaue says the sony experience has shown how small budgets and lateral thinking could drive big results. he says sony has tapped into youtube to use some of australia's most popular amateur video makers to help turn around perceptions of a web-enabled video camera and 10 of the most popular video uploaders were given the camera to use. </q> the target was the 1 per cent of youtube's audience that actually create and upload video, "laungaue says." we found that creators don't visit flashy microsites, they take stuff from everywhere.
